title: GoToAssist Seeit
description:
Allows you to integrate GoToAssist Seeit into your own solutions.

General notes:

  • GoToAssist Seeit sessions are identified by their uuid. The more readable 9 digit support key (e.g. 123-456-789) may be reused later for another session and thus cannot be used to unambiguously identify a session.
  • If not explicitly stated otherwise all timestamps represent the number of milliseconds since 1970-01-01 in UTC (similar to a Unix Timestamp but with millisecond resolution)

rel.description: The kind of link that is provided

content.description: Details for the sessions within this result page. May be an empty array if there are no sessions that match the specified query parameters

links.description: Links to the current, next and previous page (if applicable)

page.description: Details related to paging (e.g. page size, number of available pages)

size.description: Page size (i.e. number of elements within a page)

startUrl.description: The URL that can be used to start the session in a suitable browser. Valid only until the session has been finished

uuid.description: Canonical form of the [UUID](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier) uniquely identifying this session

sessionCreateTime.description: Timestamp of when the session was created via API

sessionDataDownloadUrl.description: Url of zip file containing session data like photos, notes or recording (if applicable)

sessionDataDownloadUrlExpiration.description: Timestamp of when sessionDataDownloadUrl expires. After the specified expiry date session data cannot be downloaded any longer

sessionDataPhotoCount.description: Number of photos stored for this session

sessionDataPhotoNotesCount.description: Number of photo notes stored for this session

sessionDataSize.description: Size of the session data zip file, 0 if not present

sessionDataStatus.description: A string describing the availability of session data

sessionEndTime.description: Timestamp of when the session was ended (if applicable)

sessionJoinTime.description: Timestamp of when the session was joined by the mobile app (if applicable)

sessionNotes.description: Session notes stored for this session (cut to 1000 characters)

sessionRecorded.description: true if session is being recorded, otherwise false

sessionStartTime.description: Timestamp of when the session was started in the browser (if applicable)

sessionStatus.description: A string describing the session status

startUrl.description: The URL that can be used to start the session in a suitable browser. Valid only until the session has been finished

uuid.description: Canonical form of the [UUID](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier) uniquely identifying this session

actions.title: sessions.get
actions.description:
This endpoint allows you to get all relevant details for mulitple GoToAssist Seeit sessions. Session details are available for 90 days.

The fields and their values in the response depend on session status and the time elapsed since session end; e.g. session data like snapshots or the session recording are only available for 72 hours.

The results will be paged, with paging customizable to match your requirements.

startTime.description: Optional start of date range as timestamp (will be compared against session creation time)

endTime.description: Optional end of date range as timestamp (will be compared against session creation time)

page.description: Optional page number. If not specified, page 0 is delivered

size.description: Optional page size. If not specified, 5 sessions are delivered

sort.description: Optional sort criteria, i.e. field name to sort by, optionally followed by a comma and the sort order (asc or desc). Every field available in the session details can be used as sort criteria. If not specified, result is sorted ascending by sessionCreateTime

actions.title: sessions.post
actions.description: This endpoint allows you to create a GoToAssist Seeit session. The session logically exists but is not started until you open the returned startUrl in a suitable browser.

actions.title: sessions.uuid.get
actions.description:
This endpoint allows you to get all relevant details for a single GoToAssist Seeit session. Session details are available for 90 days.

The fields and their values in the response depend on session status and the time elapsed since session end; e.g. session data like snapshots or the session recording are only available for 72 hours.

uuid.description: the uuid returned when creating the session.
